“I don’t think there’s any middle step. You either love or hate it, and that’s just life. Love the stories, love the characters, love the explicit language, love the unpredictability – or just wait for something else.”

A teen-aged girl gets the horse of her dreams and is trained by an ex-Jockey to participate in London's Grand National Steeplechase. In the course of her progress, various sorts of turmoil in her Dallastown, Pennsylvania, family life are brought to light, including her Dad's drinking and her Mom's hatred of the horse and all things remotely equine. Other performers include Ali MacGraw, Rachel Ward, and Susan Sarandon.

Although there is melodrama at the center or rather at the bottom of this film, the story is told beautifully and subtly and the acting is superb.

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The townspeople form a posse to destroy the cat, and the cat ends up killing them. Well, until they all come back and love the cat because it is now a werewolf.
